page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: The soils of the area are for the most part medium to good in quality.The plateau surface and the higher slopes of the many river valleys are used for agriculture,but the lower slopes and valley bottoms are often wooded.In some places the slopes are too steep for cultivation and are left as permanent pasture. There are eight farms in our block devoted to mixed farming with animals predominating.Each has a flock of sheep but the main income is from the diary herds(Usually freisians) Barley and wheat are grown for fodder and 2 cuts of silage or hay are taken each year.Potatoes grow well in th area. The farms are family run with sons taking over from fathers when they retire. There are a few commercial plantations of mixed woodlands.
